page.title: 01 GENERAL
page.content: The situation of block 04520087 is 3km S.W. of Ryde and 2.5km E. of Newport. It is a rural area on chalk downland which rises to 135m and includes the scarp face to the South. The land slopes gently away to the North on clay of the Hamstead beds: here it is well wooded. Narrow brooks start from a spring line along the northern edge of the chalk downs and flow northwards to the Solent. Isolated farms dominate the area along with one small Manor House, Great East Standen, which was mentioned in the 1086 Domesday Book as Standone. The county's chief rubbish dump is at Lynnbottom Copse. Roads skirt the downs, but numerous footpaths and tracks cross the downs. Main attractions in the D block are: 1) Havenstreet Railway Centre. 2) Robin Hill Country Park.
